On examination, the patient has an elevated jugular venous pressure, an S3, respiratory crackles, and bilateral pedal edema. Chest X-ray shows bronchial cuffing, fluid in the fissure, and a pleural effusion. Her ejection fraction is 38% on echocardiogram.
